reviews.text: Of all the hotels I have stayed at while traveling for work, this is one of my favorites. Vancouver isn't exactly a happening town, but it's just a 10 minute drive to Portland. This newly remodeled hotel is gorgeous and the staff is wonderful. The conference facilities are shiny and new and everything works perfectly. The underground parking lot is nice, though they do charge you about $20 for parking.
reviews.title: Amazing beds!

likes.liked: — the comfy beds and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the restaurant is fantastic (the blue cheese and bacon scramble for breakfast is amazing) and reasonably priced. But the beds - oh the beds! The beds are heaven. Quite possibly the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in - so soft, so luxurious. These beds rock.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent stay. I was upgraded to a suite, it was enormous. Windows on every wall, including the bedroom. The room overlooked the park across the street. The hotel staff were attentive and friendly. The bed was extremely comfortable as well. In all, I would highly recommend this hotel, the only small downfall, there is a railroad somewhere nearby and you do occassionally hear the train whistle.
reviews.title: We'll be back

reviews.text: Delightful check in staff who thought that our room was already occupied (computer error). They were more than accomodating in having us wait for less than 5 minutes to make sure the room was not occupied. In concession we were offered free parking as well as a comp breakfast the next morning. We attended an evening banquet of over 350 people. The banquet facility was roomy, wait staff very nice and the food was hot when it should be and cold when it should be.
reviews.title: Nice but thin walls
Very nice!
reviews.text: Well appointed, very clean rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed a quick getaway to the Hilton in Vancouver this past weekend. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly, and they have a beautiful fitness room and pool.
reviews.title: Great Getaway

likes.disliked: — Cost $35 to bring my dog & it cost extra to park.

reviews.text: Downtown Vancouver is clean and quiet, and there are several restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: nice convention hotel but front desk staff need more organization

reviews.text: Another bonus for us, considering we brought our dog, was the location to several trails, a park across from the hotel, and walking tours through the historic neighborhoods.
reviews.title: An almost perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely go back to this Hilton, and would recommend it to family and friends.
reviews.title: Very Impressive

likes.disliked: — the location a block or two down the street

reviews.title: The best beds ever!
reviews.text: Just a note... it cost an extra $35 to bring our dog.

reviews.title: Great place to stay in Vancouver!
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in March 2009. Like it says on the reservation, park in front of the main entrance to check in, even if you plan on self-parking. They'll give you a room key that also opens the gate for the parking garage. That's the only way to get into the garage. The parking garage was clean and well-lit with easy access to the lobby.

reviews.title: Beautiful furnishings
reviews.text: We had a great corner room - 702 - with windows on 2 sides and views of planes, trains, automobiles and ships. It was great! We had a great view of the Columbia River, the I-5 brdige over the river, the train tracks along the river, and the planes approaching Portland Airport. And we couldn't hear any of them from our room.
The room itself was large, spacious, clean, and in great shape. We didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the hall. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable - typical newer Hilton fare.
reviews.title: Light Sleeepers- Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't miss the little coffee shop around the corner in the lobby. In addition to great coffee drinks, they serve delicious grilled sandwiches and fresh fruit, along with the typical coffee shop goodies.
reviews.title: Great stay!

likes.disliked: — Paid parking for a small city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast certificates given to Diamond members were good for either a continental breakfast in the restaurant or $8 towards a full breakfast. And, they were also good for $8 each at the coffee shop - which will almost cover a latte and a hot breakfast sandwich.
reviews.title: Good deal.

reviews.text: Great hotel. We stayed here for one night on a trip to the Oregon coast. Managed to get a great price directly at the Hilton site. The hotel is located right off the highway in what seems to be an up and coming neighbourhood. A few blocks away seems to be the not so nice area of town. It is only 10 min from DT Portland.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Check in was easy and the people working there are friendly. The rooms are super clean and modern which is what I look for in a place. The pool and fitness area is very nice.
reviews.title: Nickel and dime you to death

reviews.text: Parking is $12/night for under ground parking. There was street parking as well for free around the hotel but it ends at 7am in the morning.
reviews.title: Great relaxing place to stay

likes.disliked: — Paying for small extras like wi fi

reviews.text: I would definetly look at staying here again.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I booked on Priceline and was thrilled that I got the Hilton for my 2 nights in Vancouver. The Hotel is beautiful. It is right across the street from Ester Short Park. The first problem was at check-in. There were 3 of us, my wife and I, and my grandson. We requested 2 queen beds. When we got to the room, we found the 2 beds were larger then twins but smaller then queens, not big enough for 2. I asked for a king and a rollaway but they didn't have any kings available. We asked for a rollaway but the room wasn't big enough for all those beds. We had a blowup bed in the car, so we ended up using it.
reviews.title: Great Location
